definitions: suitable, proper, or appropriate for a particular situation or purpose
being put in place or attached to something as required
examples: It seemed fitting to hold the memorial at sunset
The dress was a fitting choice for the formal event
The workers are fitting new windows in the building
She's fitting the pieces of the puzzle together

definitions: amounting to the cardinal number between four and six in quantity
examples: The family has five children to feed each day
We need five more minutes to finish the project

definitions: having five parts or being five times as great or as many
examples: The company experienced a fivefold increase in profits
Their efforts resulted in fivefold growth over two years

definitions: soft, loose, and lacking normal muscle tone or firmness
lacking energy, vigor, or effectiveness in action or expression
examples: His arm muscles became flaccid after months in a cast
The plant's leaves turned flaccid without enough water
The committee gave a flaccid response to the crisis
Her flaccid attempt at humor fell completely flat

definitions: becoming tired, weak, or less enthusiastic about continuing something
marking or decorating with flags or similar markers
examples: Her flagging energy showed in the final presentation
The team's flagging spirits needed an inspiring pep talk
They're flagging the dangerous areas along the trail
Workers were flagging the construction zone for safety

definitions: conspicuously offensive, shocking, or reprehensible, especially in an obvious way
examples: His flagrant disregard for safety rules caused the accident
The referee called a flagrant foul during the game

definitions: breaking or separating easily into thin, flat pieces or layers
behaving in an unreliable, eccentric, or unpredictable way
examples: The pie crust was perfectly golden and flaky
Her scalp became dry and flaky during winter
He's too flaky to trust with important responsibilities
My flaky roommate forgot to pay rent again

definitions: tending to attract attention because of exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
examples: The peacock displayed its flamboyant feathers to attract mates
His flamboyant personality made him popular at parties

definitions: burning with flames or appearing to burn brightly
showing strong emotion or being very passionate and intense
examples: The flaming logs crackled in the fireplace all night
A flaming torch lit the dark pathway ahead
They had a flaming argument about politics at dinner
His flaming temper often got him into trouble

definitions: easily ignited and capable of burning rapidly when exposed to flame
examples: Keep flammable materials away from the stove when cooking
The warehouse stores flammable chemicals in special containers

definitions: spreading gradually outward to become wider at one end
burning or shining with a sudden bright or unsteady light
examples: She wore a dress with a flaring skirt for dancing
His flaring nostrils showed his anger was building
The flaring match briefly illuminated the dark cave
Flaring torches lined the castle walls at night

definitions: ostentatiously attractive or impressive in a superficial or vulgar way
examples: He drives a flashy red sports car to impress
Her flashy jewelry caught everyone's attention at the party

definitions: made flat or level by pressing, crushing, or smoothing down
examples: The storm left flattened crops across the entire field
She found a flattened penny on the railroad tracks

definitions: making someone or something look as attractive as possible
expressing excessive or insincere praise to please someone
examples: The dress has a flattering cut that suits her figure
Soft lighting creates a flattering effect in photographs
His flattering comments seemed designed to win her favor
The review was flattering but not entirely honest

definitions: having imperfections, defects, or weaknesses that diminish value or effectiveness
examples: The diamond was beautiful despite being slightly flawed
Their flawed reasoning led to the wrong conclusion

definitions: without any blemishes, defects, or imperfections in appearance or performance
examples: Her flawless complexion needed no makeup at all
The gymnast executed a flawless routine to win gold

definitions: having grown feathers necessary for flight in young birds
having reached full development or status in a particular role
examples: The fledged chicks were ready to leave the nest
Young eagles become fully fledged after three months
She's now a fully fledged member of the medical team
The startup became a fledged company after securing funding

definitions: new and inexperienced in a particular activity or situation
examples: The fledgling company struggled to find its first customers
As a fledgling writer, she submitted stories to magazines

definitions: lasting for a very short time before disappearing or ending
examples: She caught a fleeting glimpse of the rare bird
Their happiness proved fleeting when bad news arrived

definitions: having a substantial amount of flesh or fat on the body
having a soft, thick texture resembling flesh or meat
examples: His fleshy face showed signs of good living
The baby's fleshy arms were adorable to pinch
The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that store water
Fleshy fruits like peaches are popular in summer

definitions: shining or burning unsteadily with a wavering or intermittent light
examples: The flickering candle cast dancing shadows on the wall
A flickering neon sign advertised the old motel

definitions: lacking the ability to fly, especially referring to certain bird species
examples: Penguins are flightless birds adapted for swimming instead
The dodo was a flightless bird that became extinct

definitions: made of thin material that tears easily or lacks strength
weak, inadequate, or unconvincing in nature or quality
examples: The tent's flimsy fabric tore in the strong wind
She wore a flimsy dress unsuitable for cold weather
His flimsy excuse didn't convince anyone of his innocence
The prosecution's case rested on flimsy evidence

definitions: extremely hard like the stone used to produce sparks
examples: His flint determination helped him overcome every obstacle
She gave him a flint stare that brooked no argument

definitions: behaving in a playful way that suggests romantic or sexual interest
examples: Her flirtatious smile caught his attention across the room
He found her flirtatious manner charming but not serious

definitions: resting or moving on the surface of a liquid without sinking
not permanently attached or settled in a definite place
examples: Floating ice poses dangers to ships in northern waters
Colorful leaves were floating on the pond's surface
The company maintains a floating workforce for busy periods
She has a floating work schedule that changes weekly

definitions: covered or filled with an overflow of water beyond normal limits
overwhelmed with an excessive amount of something
examples: The flooded basement required professional water damage repair
Flooded streets made driving impossible after the storm
The office was flooded with complaints about the service
Her inbox was flooded with congratulatory messages

definitions: illuminated by powerful lights that cast broad beams over an area
examples: The floodlit stadium allowed night games to be played
The floodlit castle looked magical against the dark sky

definitions: knocked down to the floor or ground by force
completely surprised, shocked, or overwhelmed by something unexpected
examples: The boxer was floored by a powerful right hook
One punch floored the challenger in the first round
I was completely floored by the unexpected job offer
The news of their divorce floored everyone who knew them

definitions: tending to hang or move in a loose, flexible way without rigidity
examples: The dog's floppy ears bounced as he ran around
She wore a floppy sun hat to the beach picnic

definitions: decorated with or depicting flowers, or relating to flowers in general
examples: She chose floral wallpaper for the guest bedroom
The bride carried a beautiful floral bouquet down the aisle

definitions: elaborately intricate or complicated in style or decoration
having a red or flushed complexion, typically from health or emotion
examples: His florid prose style made the novel difficult to read
The Victorian house featured florid architectural details
His florid face suggested high blood pressure problems
After climbing stairs, her face became quite florid

definitions: growing or developing in a healthy, vigorous, and successful way
examples: The flourishing garden produced vegetables all summer long
Her flourishing business expanded to three new locations

definitions: decorated with a pattern or design featuring flowers
having bloomed or produced flowers as part of natural growth
examples: She wore a flowered dress to the garden party
The flowered curtains brightened up the plain room
The newly flowered roses filled the air with perfume
Once the cactus flowered, it produced bright pink blooms

definitions: producing flowers or in the process of blooming
reaching the peak or most successful period of development
examples: The flowering cherry trees attract tourists every spring
Flowering plants need more water during bloom time
The Renaissance marked the flowering of art and culture
Her flowering talent as a pianist impressed the judges

definitions: covered with flowers or having many flowers growing
using elaborate, ornate, or excessively decorative language or style
examples: The flowery meadow was perfect for a summer picnic
Bees buzzed around the flowery garden all day
His flowery speech was full of unnecessary metaphors
She wrote flowery thank-you notes with excessive praise

definitions: moving along steadily and continuously in a current or stream
hanging or draping loosely and gracefully
examples: The flowing river carried boats downstream to the sea
Traffic was finally flowing smoothly after the accident cleared
Her flowing hair caught the breeze as she walked
The dancer wore flowing robes that moved beautifully

definitions: rising and falling irregularly in number, amount, or intensity
examples: The stock showed fluctuating prices throughout the trading day
Her fluctuating moods made her difficult to work with

definitions: able to speak or write smoothly, easily, and expressively
flowing or moving smoothly and effortlessly
examples: She's fluent in three languages including Mandarin Chinese
After years abroad, he became fluent in local customs
The pianist's fluent performance impressed the entire audience
Her fluent movements showed years of dance training

definitions: soft, light, and airy in texture, often with fine fibers
examples: The kitten's fluffy fur made everyone want to pet her
She piled fluffy pillows on the bed for comfort

definitions: emitting visible light when exposed to radiation such as ultraviolet light
examples: The office uses fluorescent lighting to reduce energy costs
She wore fluorescent yellow for visibility while jogging

definitions: completely level or even with another surface
having plenty of something, especially money
red in the face from strong emotion, heat, or alcohol
examples: The door should be flush with the wall frame
Make sure the tiles are flush with each other
After winning the lottery, they were flush with cash
The company is flush with new investment capital
Her face was flush with embarrassment at the mistake
He looked flush after running in the heat

definitions: having a red face from heat, emotion, illness, or exertion
examples: Her flushed cheeks showed she'd been exercising hard
The child looked flushed with fever and needed rest

definitions: relating to or occurring in a river or running water
examples: Fluvial deposits of sediment created the fertile valley
Scientists study fluvial erosion patterns along the riverbank

definitions: moving through the air with wings or in an aircraft
done quickly or briefly while moving
examples: A flying bird cast its shadow on the ground
The flying aircraft left white trails across the sky
She made a flying visit to check on her parents
He took a flying leap over the garden fence

definitions: producing or covered with a mass of small bubbles or froth
examples: The foaming waves crashed against the rocky shoreline
He applied foaming shaving cream before using the razor

definitions: relating to or located at a focus or central point of attention
examples: The fireplace serves as the focal point of the room
Her research became the focal element of the conference

definitions: directing attention or effort concentrated on a specific target or goal
examples: She remained focused despite the noisy distractions around her
A focused approach helped him achieve his career goals

definitions: directing attention or effort concentrated on a specific target or goal
examples: He stayed focussed on finishing the project before deadline
The team remained focussed throughout the intense competition

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a fetus during prenatal development
examples: The ultrasound showed normal foetal development at twenty weeks
Doctors monitored the foetal heart rate during labor
